p: In the present study, cyclophosphamide administration resulted in increased kidney weight and kidney-to-body weight ratio. This result agreed with earlier reports by several researchers. 28, 33 This might be due to the formation of cyclophosphamide-induced hydronephrosis and nodules. 34 Whereas treatment with crude extract 400 mg/kg and aqueous fractions prevented the increment in kidney weight. All treatment groups prevented increases in kidney-to-body weight ratio compared to cyclophosphamide-treated group. The antioxidant activity 24 of Croton macrostachyus might be the reason for the prevention of kidney and kidney-to-body weight increment.
